hypothesis_content.title: Futures Premium Fade During News-Driven Spikes
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC annualized futures funding rate spikes >35% (e.g., from 10% to 45%) within 24 hours following major news headlines, and the spike occurs during a NEUTRAL regime, the funding rate will normalize (-50% of the spike) faster than price adjusts, creating a short opportunity.
hypothesis_content.rationale: News-driven leverage enthusiasm in neutral regimes often overestimates immediate price impact. Market makers and arbitrageurs normalize extreme funding premiums through basis trades, pressuring perpetual prices. Current news about 'contrarian buy signals' could create such sentiment spikes.
entry_conditions: BTC annualized funding rate increases >35% absolute within 24 hours
Spike follows identifiable news event (headline sentiment >0.7)
Price has moved <2% during funding spike
Entry on next hourly close after funding rate peaks

exit_conditions.take_profit: Funding rate declines by 50% from spike peak
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Funding rate increases another 15% from entry

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Funding rate spikes during neutral regimes lead to sustained high rates (>24 hours) and price rallies >5% in more than 30% of cases, indicating genuine bullish positioning.
